That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CSD21-016, dated December 6, 2021 of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That Council increase the budget by $50,000 from the original $50,000 budget to finance the expansion of activities related to developing the Community Safety and Well Being Plan with the increase to be funded from the Social Services Reserve; and b) That Council endorse a change in the target deadline for completing the Community Safety and Well-being Plan from Spring 2022 to December 31, 2022. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSES21-026, dated December 6, 2021, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That staff be directed to hire 2 Full Time Equivalent staff to support the requirements of the contract, as outlined in the Operating Requirements section of the report; and b) That the CAO and Clerk be authorized to execute contracts/agreements and other documents, for the period April 1, 2022 to March 31, 2027, to the satisfaction to the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services and the City Solicitor, as required, with respect to the Water-Wastewater Service Agreement for Cavan Monaghan as outlined in Report IPSES21-026.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSFS21-035, dated December 6, 2021 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That Council receive the presentation and report prepared by Buy Social Canada CCC Ltd. and attached to Report CLSFS21-035 as Appendix A; b) That Council support the next steps in the implementation of social procurement for the City of Peterborough, including the design, training, education, engagement and development of a Social Procurement Policy for consideration at a future meeting of Council; c) That the $100,000 Social Procurement Capital Budget be increased by an amount of $208,100 for a total of $308,100 and that the increase be funded by a transfer from the Capital Levy Reserve; d) That Council approve a three-year social procurement implementation strategy including: i. Entering into a 3-year agreement with Buy Social Canada CCC Ltd. 503-535 Thurlow St. Vancouver, BC V6E 3L2 at a cost of $94,200 plus HST of $12,246 for a total cost of $106,446; and ii. Hiring a part-time staff backfill on a two-year contract at a cost of $112,250 to assist in the day-to-day operations of the Purchasing Section. e) That the Mayor and City Clerk be authorized to execute an Agreement with Buy Social Canada CCC Ltd. for a three-year term from January 1, 2022 to December 31, 2024 for the development of a social procurement implementation strategy for the City of Peterborough on terms acceptable to the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services and in a form acceptable to the City Solicitor.

x) Peterborough Green Up Kemi Akapo xi) Showplace Performance Centre Dean Pappas That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CSACH21-012, dated December 6, 2021, of the Commissioner of Community Services, as follows: a) That the recommendation of the Peterborough Architectural Conservation Advisory Committee (PACAC) dated September 5, 2019 to designate the properties known municipally as 610 Parkhill Road (Jackson Park) and 575 Bonaccord Street (Hamilton Park), legally described on page 2 of the attached Heritage Designation Brief, as a cultural heritage landscape under Part IV, Section 29 of the Ontario Heritage Act (R.S.O. 1990, c.o.18) being of "cultural heritage value or interest" be approved; and, b) That Council’s intention to designate be advertised in a newspaper having general circulation in the municipality as per the Ontario Heritage Act R.S.O. 1990, c.O.18, s.29 (3); and, c) That the owners of the properties to be designated, and the Ontario Heritage Trust, be served with a Notice of Intention to Designate as per the Ontario Heritage Act R.S.O. 1990, c.O.18, s.29 (3)
